description: {"blocks":[{"key":"f83do","text":"This protocol describes the isolation of nuclei from snap-frozen human placental tissue for bulk ATACseq. It is a modified version of a protocol (SCBL Protocols - 10x Multiome Nuclei Isolation) supplied by the Jackson Laboratory (JAX), which is itself modified from Sigma Aldrich's Nuclei Isolation Kit: Nuclei EZ Prep protocol, and 10x Genomics' Demonstrated Protocol – Nuclei Isolation for Single Cell Multiome ATAC + Gene Expression Sequencing. It is recommended to work with no more than four samples at a time so that all samples can be processed in a timely manner.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgbkn","text":"Get the following materials ready; you won't have time to do this in between steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7nf9r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rh7b","text":"4 x #22 disposable scalpels","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etard","text":"4 x 60mm Petri dishes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50im3","text":"4 x disposable pestles/tubes, along with cordless motor","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2v79t","text":"4 x disposable tweezers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e42pn","text":"4 x 40um filters","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5l49c","text":"4 x 20um filters","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ki8g","text":"4 x BioRad counting slides","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5aud","text":"0.4% Trypan Blue stain","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a84r","text":"200ul wide bore filter tips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ari20","text":"1000ul wide bore filter tips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"22d48","text":"Place a sterile Petri dish onto the chilled metal plate sitting on ice. Move tube containing first placenta sample from dry ice to wet ice for ~30 seconds, then tap slightly-thawed tissue into pre-chilled Petri dish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3dso","text":"Pull snap-frozen placenta samples (~150-200 mg each) from -80 °C  and place on dry ice until ready to process.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m6fi","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"38p5l","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"70osb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"84l4f","text":"This protocol describes nuclei isolation from 4 snap-frozen samples at a time. It is helpful to fill out  a checklist (see below for example) to keep track of where each sample is in the protocol as you work through the various steps. Samples are staggered in such a way that the first sample is one step ahead of the second sample, which is one step ahead of the third sample, and so on.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9bvku","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"file","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"DB7395B0A5BD11ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":218092,"original_name":"ATACseq_sample_tracker.pdf","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/files/gw9n86jn.pdf"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ujro","text":"Cut tissue into small pieces (~ 2 to 3mm in size) using a fresh disposable #22 scalpel. Use disposable tweezers to hold tissue in place while cutting. Transfer tissue into labeled pre-chilled microfuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7unl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bmo2n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b849c","text":"Take care when cutting. If tissue is too hard and/or too much pressure is applied with the scalpel, tissue can fly out of the Petri dish. Cut cautiously and slowly to begin with - it is sometimes helpful to rock the blade from side to side to gradually split the frozen tissue. As the tissue thaws it gets a little easier to cut, but if it is allowed to thaw too much then it gets more difficult.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"914im","text":"Label 4 microfuge tubes (the ones that are supplied with the disposable pestles) with sample names and pre-chill on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1j2ov","text":"Add   and grind tissue with a disposable pestle attached to a cordless motor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"53f79","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3grpa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3n4v2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"125","error":false,"guid":"5F698EE0A5C011ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"lysis buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e4hhm","text":"It should only take a few 5 second pulses to achieve a \"smoothie-like\" consistency. Do not over-grind.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"64ar2","text":"Place ground-up tissue on ice for  . During this time you can start step 11 for the second placenta sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bcqmb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"667975F0A5C111ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ou3f","text":"Centrifuge sample  . During this time you can start step 11 for the third placenta sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6jeb9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"500","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"941D44A0A5C111ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5i716","text":"Remove and discard supernatant, and resuspend pellet gently in   using 200ul wide bore filter tips. Incubate on ice for  . During this time you can start step 11 for the fourth placenta sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":63,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":120,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1nob6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"D74C0F40A5C111ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"fresh lysis buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"F35FB650A5C111ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2opja","text":"Using a 1000ul wide bore filter tip, add  , mix gently, and centrifuge  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":71,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"35C69D10A5C211ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"wash buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"500","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"47D23640A5C211ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a3ehe","text":"Remove and discard supernatant and repeat wash twice, saving the last suspension on ice until all samples reach this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5seec","text":"Filter each sample though a 40um filter into a fresh microfuge tube. To maximize recovery of nuclei, wash old microfuge tube with  , and pass through the same 40um filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":130,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5137p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"C218F310A68C11ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"fresh wash buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ek3e6","text":"Repeat previous step, this time with a 20um filter. This filter will remove debris that wasn't removed in the previous step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6h1qb","text":"Centrifuge  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":11,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cd31g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"500","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"707C5A00A68D11ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"87um3","text":"Remove and discard supernatant carefully, and gently resuspend pellet in   using 200ul wide bore filter tip. Clumps of nuclei should break up easily. Place resuspended nuclei on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":73,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"75a6m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"9733B2B0A68D11ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"tagmentation buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cbhr5","text":"Take   aliquot of resuspended nuclei; add   and  . Flick to mix, then load   to both sides of a BioRad counting slide. Determine nuclei concentration using an automated cell counter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":42,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8b83k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"997bl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hfkq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"C9760FC0A68D11ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"D5920980A68D11ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"tagmentation buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"DCAA9890A68D11ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"0.4% Trypan blue stain","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"087C3F50A68E11ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c5b8h","text":"Nuclei should stain light blue; not too dark as that would indicate damage to the nuclear membrane. Nuclei should not be clumped together, and there should be little debris.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6s8f8","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5uvmt","text":"  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d4bor","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"6D25F120A68F11ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","height":733,"id":218900,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":"step-C3227E60A68D11ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0-nested-draft-8b83k","original_name":"IMG_3502.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx2y86jn.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx2w86jn.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx2x86jn.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gx2v86jn.webp","width":550},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ds07","text":"Based on nuclei concentration, prepare   of a 5,000 nuclei/ul solution (50,000 total nuclei), using tagmentation buffer for dilution. Proceed immediately to tagmentation and library preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8u4vb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"54ch2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27bin","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"DED97490A68F11ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"26qan","text":"It helps to use a pre-formulated Excel spreadsheet to quickly determine the volume of nuclei and tagmentation buffer to use. Several intermediate dilutions are often required to ensure that pipetting volumes are sensible. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hopu","text":"Centrifuge remaining nuclei from step 22  . Remove and discard supernatant, and gently resuspend nuclei in   using 200ul wide bore filter tips, making sure to break up clumps of nuclei. Store nuclei at   for up to several months.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":107,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":202,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eneka","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"500","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"D94D3560A69011ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"1880B680A69111ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"Nuclei EZ Storage Buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3A2B0790A69111ECA19C4BF6BCB28EC0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}
